description: From Medieval Latin *dētrīmentālis, from Latin dētrīmentum (“harm”), from dēterō (“to rub off, wear”), from dē- (“down, away”) + terō (“to rub or grab”).

adjectives.description: detrimental (comparative more detrimental, superlative most detrimental)

examples: Synonyms: harmful, damaging, injurious; see also Thesaurus:harmful
Smoking tobacco can be detrimental to your health.
